content.json:
## Admin Audit Log

** This workbook requires Option 1** (upload of the OfficeActivity logs)

**Selection of an environment is unavailable. As this workbook is based on the OfficeActivity Logs (Microsoft 365 Solution) directly linked to the Microsoft Sentinel Environment, we cannot provide a view of another one.**

parameters.name: EnvironmentList
parameters.label: Environment
parameters.query:
OfficeActivity | where TimeGenerated {TimeRange}
 | summarize by OrganizationName

content.json: If needed, select an item in the dropdownlist. Dropdownlist are independent.

parameters.name: Admin
parameters.query:
let ExcludedCmdlet = externaldata (Cmdlet:string)[h"https://aka.ms/ExcludedCmdletWatchlist"]with(format="csv",ignoreFirstRecord=true)| project Cmdlet;
MESOfficeActivityLogs
| where TimeGenerated {TimeRange}
| where CmdletName !in (ExcludedCmdlet)
| extend Caller = replace_string(Caller, '\\', '\\\\')
| extend admin = Caller
| distinct admin

parameters.name: CmdLet

content.json:
**How to understand the data**

These information are extracted from the OfficeActivity logs.

Each entry is analyzed regarding the following conditions :

  - Check if the Target Object is a VIP. The VIP list is based on the watchlist "Exchange VIP".

  - Check if the Cdmlet is a Sensitive Cmdlet. The Sensitive Cmdlet list is based on the watchlist "Monitored Exchange Cmdlets". 
   - This list contains the list of Cmdlet that are considered as Sensitive. 
   - Some Cmdlet will be considered as Sensitive only if some specific parameters defined in the "Monitored Exchange Cmdlets" watchlist are used.

Column explainatations : 
  - Caller : Named of the Administrators that used this cmdlet
  - TargetObject : Object modified by the cmdlet
  - IsVIP : If the Target Object part of the "Exchange VIP" watchlist
  - Cmdlet : Name of the cmdlet that was used
  - CmdletParameters : Cmdlet parameters used with the command
  - IsSensitive :
   - true : This cmdlet is Sensitive because it was part of the list of the "Monitored Exchange Cmdlets" watchlist and Sensitive parameters have been used for cmdlet with specifc sensitive parameters

content.query:
let ExcludedCmdlet = externaldata (Cmdlet:string)[h"https://aka.ms/ExcludedCmdletWatchlist"]with(format="csv",ignoreFirstRecord=true)| project Cmdlet;
MESOfficeActivityLogs
| where TimeGenerated {TimeRange}
| where  Caller in ({Admin}) and CmdletName in ({CmdLet})
| where CmdletName !in (ExcludedCmdlet)
| extend TargetObject = iif(IsVIP == true and TargetObject !="" , strcat("ðŸ‘‘ ",TargetObject), TargetObject )
| extend CmdletName = iif(IsSensitive == true and TargetObject !="", strcat("ðŸ’¥ ",CmdletName), CmdletName )
| extend IsVIP = iif(IsVIP == true and TargetObject !="" , strcat("ðŸ‘‘ ",tostring(IsVIP)), tostring(IsVIP ))
| extend IsSensitive = iif(IsSensitive == true and TargetObject !="", strcat("ðŸ’¥ ",tostring(IsSenstiveCmdlet)), tostring(IsSenstiveCmdlet))
| project TimeGenerated, Caller,IsVIP,TargetObject,IsSensitive,CmdletName,CmdletParameters
| sort by TimeGenerated desc

content.title: Total Cmdlets for the Time Range

content.query:
let ExcludedCmdlet = externaldata (Cmdlet:string)[h"https://aka.ms/ExcludedCmdletWatchlist"]with(format="csv",ignoreFirstRecord=true)| project Cmdlet;
MESOfficeActivityLogs
| where TimeGenerated {TimeRange}
| where CmdletName !in (ExcludedCmdlet)
| extend Caller
| extend CmdletName
| summarize Count=count() by CmdletName

content.title: Total Unique Cmdlet per Account for the Time Range
Total List of Cmdlets

content.query:
let ExcludedCmdlet = externaldata (Cmdlet:string)[h"https://aka.ms/ExcludedCmdletWatchlist"]with(format="csv",ignoreFirstRecord=true)| project Cmdlet;
MESOfficeActivityLogs
| where TimeGenerated {TimeRange}
| where CmdletName !in (ExcludedCmdlet)
| extend Account = Caller
| summarize Count=count() by CmdletName, Account
| sort by Count asc
content.title: List of Cmdlet per Account

content.json: This section displayed the list of Cmdlet used in your environment for the defined period of time with the number of time they have been used.
This section will display the list of Cmdlet launch by Administrators for the defined period of time and the number of time they have been used

# Workbook goals
The goals of this workbook is to allow search in the Exchange Admin Audit log.

The source of this workbook is not an export of the Admin Audit log mailbox but an export of the MSExchange Management for each Exchange servers.

If the Admin Audit Log is bypassed, the information won't be displayed in this workbook as there is  no method to track this data.

## Tabs

Let quicly review the content of each tab

### Cmdlets Analysis

This tab will show for the defined time range :
  - A summary of all cmdets used

  - A summary of all cmdlets used by each Account

### Global Admin Audit Log

This tab allow to globally search in the exported Admin Audit log content.

When Sensitive Cmdlets and/or Sensitive parameters are used, specific informations will be displayed.

When VIP user are manipulated, specific informations will be displayed.

For more informations on how to understand each Column, refer to "How to understand the data"


### AdminAuditLog for Org Mgmt

This tab allow to globally search in the exported Admin Audit log content for only account members on the Organization Management groups.

When Sensitive Cmdlets and/or Sensitive parameters are used, specific informations will be displayed.

When VIP user are manipulated, specific informations will be displayed.

For more informations on how to understand each Column, refer to "How to understand the data"
